devanagari:
सोपि भगवा अरहं,
सम्मासम्बुद्धो सयम्भू;
विज्‍जाचरणसम्पन्‍नो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sopi bhagavā arahaṃ,
Sammāsambuddho sayambhū;
Vijjācaraṇasampanno,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
To Him, who was freed from all impurities, the Worthy One,
Enlightened by his own efforts, Lord of oneself,
Perfect in theory and practice.

vocabulary.composition: vijjā + caraṇa + sampanno wisdom + practise + being endowed

devanagari:
पुरिसदम्मसारथी,
लोकविदू अनुत्तरो;
सत्थादेवमनुस्सानं,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Purisadammasārathī,
Lokavidū anuttaro;
Satthādevamanussānaṃ,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Trainer of men,
Incomparable knower of all the worlds,
Teacher of gods and men alike.

vocabulary.composition: purisa + damma + sārathī men + trainer + charioteer

vocabulary.meaning: incomparable knower of all the worlds
vocabulary.composition: loka + vidū + anuttaro world/universe + knowing + incomparable/unrivalled

vocabulary.meaning: teacher of gods and men alike

devanagari:
सुगतो सुगदो सामी,
सुखदो सन्तिदायको;
सब्बसत्तानुकम्पको,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sugato sugado sāmī,
Sukhado santidāyako;
Sabbasattānukampako,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was wellgone, endowed with eloquence, Lord of his own,
Dispenser of peace and happiness,
Compassionate towards all beings.

vocabulary.composition: sabba + sattā + anukampakoall + beings + having compassion, feeling pity

devanagari:
सब्बुत्तमो सत्था सेट्ठो,
समणग्गो सन्तिस्सरो;
अरियधम्मं अञ्‍ञासि.
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbuttamo satthā seṭṭho,
Samaṇaggo santissaro;
Ariyadhammaṃ aññāsi.
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Best and greatest amongst teachers,
Foremost among monks, Lord of peace,
Supreme knower of the Noble Dhamma.

vocabulary.meaning: supreme knower of the Noble Dhamma

devanagari:
भग्गरागो भग्गदोसो,
भग्गमोहो सो भगवा;
भग्गमानो भग्गमायो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Bhaggarāgo bhaggadoso,
Bhaggamoho so bhagavā;
Bhaggamāno bhaggamāyo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who had vanquished all cravings, aversions, ignorance
And conceits and deceits.
Truly an Exalted One was he.

vocabulary.composition: bhagga: pp. of bhañjati	break, break up, destroy

devanagari:
यथावादी तथाकारी,
तथपत्तो तथागतो;
यथाकारी तथावादी,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Yathāvādī tathākārī,
Tathapatto tathāgato;
Yathākārī tathāvādī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha
Whatever he preached he practised accordingly,
Having attained the highest truth,
He is known as the Tathāgata,
Practising whatever he taught.

devanagari:
धम्मनियामे कोविदो,
धम्मतायपि कोविदो;
धम्मट्ठितिया कोविदो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammaniyāme kovido,
Dhammatāyapi kovido;
Dhammaṭṭhitiyā kovido,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Skillful and wise in Dhammic laws,
In Dhammic regulations, in its protection and stability.

devanagari:
वीतरागो वीतदोसो,
वीतकोधो वीतभयो;
वीतासवो वीतमोहो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Vītarāgo vītadoso,
Vītakodho vītabhayo;
Vītāsavo vītamoho,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Freed from all craving and aversion,
Without ill-will or fear,
He was freed from all mental defilements and ignorance.

vocabulary.composition: vīta: pp. of eti		gone, freed from, deprived

devanagari:
महावीरो महाधीरो,
महासूरो महब्बलो;
महामारचमू मद्दि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahāvīro mahādhīro,
Mahāsūro mahabbalo;
Mahāmāracamū maddi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was brave and wise,
Courageous and strong,
And who vanquished the great army of Mara.

vocabulary.composition: mahā + māra + camū great + Mara + army

devanagari:
महासीलो महाचित्तो,
महाबुधो महामुनि;
महामोहोदधिं तिण्णो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahāsīlo mahācitto,
Mahābudho mahāmuni;
Mahāmohodadhiṃ tiṇṇo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who strictly observed all moral precepts,
And practised the highest stage of concentration,
A supreme sage possessing great wisdom,
He crossed the vast ocean of ignorance.

vocabulary.meaning: perfect in observing all moral precepts
practised the highest stage of concentration

devanagari:
महामोहं विनासेसि,
महारागनिरोधको;
महादोसं निद्धंसेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahāmohaṃ vināsesi,
Mahārāganirodhako;
Mahādosaṃ niddhaṃsesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who destroyed all forms of ignorance,
Who stopped the surging of passions,
Who completely shattered all aversions.

devanagari:
महानन्दीसमुच्छिन्‍नो,
महाकिलेसनिस्सटो;
महापापोघमुत्तिण्णो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahānandīsamucchinno,
Mahākilesanissaṭo;
Mahāpāpoghamuttiṇṇo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who completely eradicated all craving,
Rejected (escaped from) great lust and passion,
and successfully crossed the great flood of sin.

vocabulary.meaning: crossed the great flood of sin

devanagari:
महासोकसल्‍लकत्तो,
महाखीलविसोधनो;
महासन्तिसुखकरो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahāsokasallakatto,
Mahākhīlavisodhano;
Mahāsantisukhakaro,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The supreme surgeon who removed grief and woe,
A radical destroyer of the strong stakes of craving,
And a great harbinger of peace and happiness.

vocabulary.composition: dealing with terrible grief and woe

vocabulary.word: great + grief + arrow + cut off, remove)

vocabulary.meaning: a radical destroyer of the strong stakes of craving
vocabulary.composition: mahā + khīla + visodhano	great + pillar, post + cleansing

vocabulary.meaning: a great harbinger of peace and happiness
vocabulary.composition: mahā + santi + sukha + karo	great + peace + happiness + giver

devanagari:
महाभयं पदालेसि,
छम्भच्छिन्‍नो भयनुदो;
महादुक्खक्खन्धनुदो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahābhayaṃ padālesi,
Chambhacchinno bhayanudo;
Mahādukkhakkhandhanudo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who destroyed all terror,
Drove away all forms of fear and stupefaction,
And expelled the greatest mass of suffering.

vocabulary.meaning: drove away all forms of fear

vocabulary.composition: mahā + dukkha + k + khandha + nudo	great + suffering + multitude + dispel

devanagari:
महाकरुणासम्पत्तो,
महामेत्तायभिरतो;
महाजनहितरतो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahākaruṇāsampatto,
Mahāmettāyabhirato;
Mahājanahitarato,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was supremely compassionate,
Took delight in radiating paramount loving-kindness,
And was fully devoted to bringing the highest welfare to all.

vocabulary.meaning: took delight in radiating utmost loving-kindness
vocabulary.composition: mahā + mettāya + abhirato	great + compassion + delighting in

vocabulary.meaning: fully devoted in bringing highest welfare to the greatest number of people
vocabulary.composition: mahā + jana + hita + rato	great + people + benefit + enjoying

devanagari:
महा-अविज्‍जा पम्मद्दि,
मायाजालविमोचनो;
मिच्छावादं निमद्देसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahā-avijjā pammaddi,
Māyājālavimocano;
Micchāvādaṃ nimaddesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who destroyed great ignorance,
Smashed the net of conceit and deceit,
And shattered false beliefs born out of ignorance.

vocabulary.meaning: smashed the net of conceit and deceit
vocabulary.composition: māyā + jāla + vimocano	conceit + net + release

vocabulary.meaning: false beliefs born from false doctrine

devanagari:
महागुरु नरगुरु,
देवगुरु गुरुवरो;
जेट्ठगुरु सेट्ठगुरु,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahāguru naraguru,
Devaguru guruvaro;
Jeṭṭhaguru seṭṭhaguru,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The great and supreme teacher of men and gods,
The highest teacher, foremost of outstanding qualities.

vocabulary.meaning: a foremost teacher of outstanding qualities

devanagari:
विस्सगुरु लोकगुरु,
धम्मगुरु गुरुत्तमो;
नत्थि एतादिसो गुरु,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Vissaguru lokaguru,
Dhammaguru guruttamo;
Natthi etādiso guru,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The universal teacher, the teacher of the entire world,
A teacher of Dhamma par excellence,
There is no other teacher like Him.

devanagari:
एहिपस्सिकं धम्मदो,
सन्दिट्ठिकमकालिकं,
ओपनयिकं स्वाक्खातं,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ehipassikaṃ dhammado,
Sandiṭṭhikamakālikaṃ,
Opanayikaṃ svākkhātaṃ,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who taught the Dhamma, with the quality “come and see for yourself”,
Which gives immediate result in this very world, which should be understood,
And is so well expounded and leads nearer and nearer to the highest goal (step by step).

vocabulary.meaning: having the quality “come and see for yourself!”
showing result in this very life

devanagari:
सब्बञेय्यधम्मं ञत्वा,
ञत्तधम्मं अदेसयि;
अभिञ्‍ञाञाणसम्पुण्णो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbañeyyadhammaṃ ñatvā,
Ñattadhammaṃ adesayi;
Abhiññāñāṇasampuṇṇo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who, endowed with supreme wisdom,
Having fully realized the entity of Dhamma,
Preached it in full detail.

vocabulary.composition: sabba + ñeyya + dhammaṃ,all + what should be known + Dhamma

vocabulary.meaning: endowed with supreme kind of wisdom
vocabulary.composition: abhiññā + ñāṇa + sampuṇṇo,highest wisdom + knowledge + filled

devanagari:
विचित्रधम्मकथिको,
अब्भुतमग्गुद्देसको;
महक्खातो महाकथी,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Vicitradhammakathiko,
Abbhutamagguddesako;
Mahakkhāto Mahākathī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who so eloquently enunciated the rare Dhamma,
Guided people to follow that marvellous path,
Fully explained and expounded Dhamma in all aspects.

vocabulary.meaning: guided people to follow that marvellous path
vocabulary.composition: abbhuta + magga + uddesako	wonderful, marvellous + path + pointing out, indicating

devanagari:
अदण्डेन असत्थेन,
धम्मेन अनुसासयी;
उद्धरेसि बहू सत्ते,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Adaṇḍena asatthena,
Dhammena anusāsayī;
Uddharesi bahū satte,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who ruled righteously (without any stick nor any weapon),
And liberated a great number of beings (showing them the light of Dhamma).

devanagari:
यथा अदक्खि अक्खासि,
भगवा भूरिञाणवा,
निक्‍कामो निम्मलो नाथो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Yathā adakkhi akkhāsi,
Bhagavā bhūriñāṇavā,
Nikkāmo nimmalo nātho,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who expounded what he experienced,
The Exalted One, full of Wisdom,
Free from lust, a pristine pure guardian of mankind.

devanagari:
अत्तसरणमनुसासि,
नेपक्‍को अनुसासको;
धम्मसरणमनुसासि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Attasaraṇamanusāsi,
Nepakko anusāsako;
Dhammasaraṇamanusāsi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who taught to take refuge in oneself and in Dhamma,
Who was a discriminating seer and a strict disciplinarian.

vocabulary.meaning: taught to take refuge in oneself
taught to take refuge in Dhamma.

devanagari:
निम्ममो निरहङ्कारो,
निरालम्बो निरालयो;
निप्पपञ्‍चो निरारम्भो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Nimmamo nirahaṅkāro,
Nirālambo nirālayo;
Nippapañco nirārambho,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from yearning and egoism,
Without any support and free from desires and defilements,
Free from all hindrances to spiritual progress he had nothing to sacrifice.

devanagari:
निरासन्को निरातङ्को,
निराकङ्खो निरङ्ग्रणो;
निस्सङ्किलिट्ठो निस्सङ्गो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Nirāsanko nirātaṅko,
Nirākaṅkho niraṅgraṇo;
Nissaṅkiliṭṭho nissaṅgo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from doubts, diseases, from longing and mental defilements,
Fully liberated from woes and attachments.

devanagari:
न्हातो धोतो निद्धोतो,
नित्तण्हो नित्थरणिको;
निब्बुतो निरोधप्पत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Nhāto dhoto niddhoto,
Nittaṇho nittharaṇiko;
Nibbuto nirodhappatto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was (always) clean, washed and resplendent,
Without any more longing he crossed the ocean of existence,
Allayed, he attained the state of cessation.

vocabulary.composition: nirodha + p + pāpuṇāti: pp.,cessation + having obtained

devanagari:
निब्भयो नरनिसभो,
निच्छम्भी नरकेसरी;
निद्दरो यो नराजञ्‍ञो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Nibbhayo naranisabho,
Nicchambhī narakesarī;
Niddaro yo narājañño,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was fearless, a bull amongst men,
Without panic, like a lion amongst men,
Without anxiety or distress he belonged to the noble lineage.

devanagari:
नरानं वरनायको,
ञाणिको ञाणभूसनो;
ञाणपारगू ञाणगू,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Narānaṃ varanāyako,
Ñāṇiko ñāṇabhūsano;
Ñāṇapāragū ñāṇagū,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The most capable leader of men, very wise, possessing jewels of wisdom,
He transcended the limits of knowledge and was imbued with knowledge’s essence.

vocabulary.meaning: imbued with the essence of knowledge

devanagari:
ञाणञ्‍ञू ञाणसम्पन्‍नो,
पञ्‍ञासम्पन्‍नो सब्बञ्‍ञू;
धम्मञ्‍ञू धम्मसम्पन्‍नो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ñāṇaññū ñāṇasampanno,
Paññāsampanno sabbaññū;
Dhammaññū dhammasampanno,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was highly knowledgeable,
possessing wealth of knowledge and deep wisdom,
Of omniscient knowledge,
And endowed with its wealth he was well-versed in Dhamma.

vocabulary.meaning: well-versed in Dhamma, knowing it well

devanagari:
ञाणमयो ञाणालयो,
 ञाणेसी ञाणकोविदो;
ञाणदस्सनसम्पन्‍नो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ñāṇamayo ñāṇālayo,
Ñāṇesī ñāṇakovido;
Ñāṇadassanasampanno,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was full of lore, the embodiment of knowledge,
A researcher of knowledge he possessed extraordinary wisdom,
Who was blessed with the vision of knowledge.

vocabulary.meaning: blessed with the vision of knowledge

devanagari:
ञाणभासी ञाणविदू,
कालभासी कालविदू;
सच्‍चभासी सच्‍चविदू,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ñāṇabhāsī ñāṇavidū,
Kālabhāsī kālavidū;
Saccabhāsī saccavidū,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
He with all the knowledge spoke wisely.
Always at the proper time he knew the appropriate time to speak,
And always truthful, having realized the truth himself.

vocabulary.meaning: in store of all the knowledge
knowing the appropriate time to speak

devanagari:
मायामुत्तो मोहमुत्तो,
मक्खमुत्तो मुत्तमदो;
किच्छामुत्तो मुच्छामुत्तो.
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Māyāmutto mohamutto,
Makkhamutto muttamado;
Kicchāmutto mucchāmutto.
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was released from deceit and ignorance,
Freed from hypocrisy and pride,
He was rid of all distress and infatuation.

devanagari:
दोसमुत्तो दोहमुत्तो,
देस्समुत्तो मुत्तदिसो;
ओघमुत्तो अघमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dosamutto dohamutto,
Dessamutto muttadiso;
Oghamutto aghamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Free from aversion, he never injured others,
Free from disagreeableness and enmity,
Liberated from the floods of depravity and sin.

devanagari:
सङ्गमुत्तो रङ्गमुत्तो,
रागमुत्तो मुत्तरति;
नन्दीमुत्तो तण्हामुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Saṅgamutto raṅgamutto,
Rāgamutto muttarati;
Nandīmutto taṇhāmutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from attachment and clinging,
From craving and sensual pleasures,
Free from longing and from desires.

devanagari:
इतिमुत्तो भीतिमुत्तो,
छम्भमुत्तो मुत्तभयो;
आधिमुत्तो व्याधिमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Itimutto bhītimutto,
Chambhamutto muttabhayo;
Ādhimutto vyādhimutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from calamities and fears, from panic and terror,
And free from mental and physical afflictions.

devanagari:
आसामुत्तो इस्सामुत्तो,
एजामुत्तो मुत्त-इणो;
मानमुत्तो वानमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Āsāmutto issāmutto,
Ejāmutto mutta-iṇo;
Mānamutto vānamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who did not entertain hopes, he was free from envy,
Released from longing and all liability,
He was free from vanity and lust.

devanagari:
ओरमुत्तो पारमुत्तो, 
घोरमुत्तो मुत्तगहो;
कप्पमुत्तो कालमुत्तो. 
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Oramutto pāramutto, 
Ghoramutto muttagaho; 
Kappamutto kālamutto.
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was liberated from this and the next world, 
Liberated from the horrible and likewise from all grasping,
Redeemed from millennia and the cycles of time.

vocabulary.meaning: the near and the far shore, the below and the above
redeemed from the cycles of time

devanagari:
खन्धमुत्तो बन्धमुत्तो,
कलिमुत्तो मुत्तमलो;
सब्बथा पिपासामुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Khandhamutto bandhamutto,
Kalimutto muttamalo;
Sabbathā pipāsāmutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from aggregates and bondage (of clinging),
From sins and from defilement,
And completely redeemed from greed and desires.

vocabulary.meaning: completely redeemed from greed and desires
in every way + thirst, longing, desire + liberated

devanagari:
वङ्कमुत्तो पङ्कमुत्तो,
खेदमुत्तो मुत्तखिलो;
सब्बदा आतङ्कमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Vaṅkamutto paṅkamutto,
Khedamutto muttakhilo;
Sabbadā ātaṅkamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from crookedness and dishonesty,
Free from regrets and stubbornness,
Always unaffected by torment.

devanagari:
अहङ्कारा विनिमुत्तो,
ममङ्कारा मुत्तो मुनि;
मानावमाना विमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ahaṅkārā vinimutto,
Mamaṅkārā mutto muni;
Mānāvamānā vimutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was completely free from egoism,
A sage, free from selfish attachments,
Indifferent to honour and dishonour.

devanagari:
सब्बदा सम्मोसमुत्तो,
सम्मोहमुत्तो सब्बथा;
सब्बधि सन्तापमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbadā sammosamutto,
Sammohamutto sabbathā;
Sabbadhi santāpamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was always free from confusion,
In every way unobstructed from infatuation,
In every respect liberated from burning.

devanagari:
सब्बासवा विनिमुत्तो,
सदा विलग्गमानसो;
सब्बासज्जा विप्पमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbāsavā vinimutto,
Sadā vilaggamānaso;
Sabbāsajjā vippamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was completely freed from all mental defilements,
Always in a state of detachment
he was completely indifferent to all attachments.

vocabulary.meaning: completely freed from all mental defilements
always in a state of detachment
approach, come near to, having attained

devanagari:
कामतण्ह विनिमुत्तो,
भवतण्हाविभञ्जको;
विभवतण्हविक्खीणो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Kāmataṇha vinimutto,
Bhavataṇhāvibhañjako;
Vibhavataṇhavikkhīṇo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was completely free from the greed for sensual pleasures,
Who was the dissector of craving for existences,
The destroyer of craving for non-existence.

vocabulary.meaning: completely free from the greed for sensual pleasures
the dissector of craving for existences

devanagari:
सब्बथा विब्भममुत्तो,
विब्भन्तिमुत्तो सब्बधि;
सब्बविपल्लासमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbathā vibbhamamutto,
Vibbhantimutto sabbadhi;
Sabbavipallāsamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was always free from all illusions,
In every way free from all delusions,
Free from all perversions.

vocabulary.meaning: in every way free from all delusions

devanagari:
सब्बन्तरायविमुत्तो,
अग्गलमुत्तो सब्बधि;
सब्बब्यवधानमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbantarāyavimutto,
Aggalamutto sabbadhi;
Sabbabyavadhānamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free of all hindrances,
In every way, free of all obstructions,
Fetters and impediments.

vocabulary.meaning: lit: bolt fasteining the door: can not enter, fig.: obstruction
free of all fetters and impediments

devanagari:
भवनेत्तिया विमुत्तो,
भवोघमुत्तमानसो;
सब्बत्थ संयोगमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Bhavanettiyā vimutto,
Bhavoghamuttamānaso;
Sabbattha saṃyogamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was completely free from the cravings of rebirth,
And the tides of rebirth as well,
Liberated from bondage everywhere.

vocabulary.meaning: completely free from the cravings of rebirth
free from the tides of rebirth

devanagari:
सब्बथा सङ्कोपमुत्तो,
ब्यापादमुत्तो सब्बदा;
सब्बधि पटिघमुत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbathā saṅkopamutto,
Byāpādamutto sabbadā;
Sabbadhi paṭighamutto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Completely free from abstractions,
Who was always free from ill will and anger.

vocabulary.meaning: in any way free from anger

devanagari:
लोकमित्तो लोकहितो,
लोकहन्धु लोकसखा;
तिलोके आलोककरो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Lokamitto lokahito,
Lokabandhu lokasakhā;
Tiloke ālokakaro,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was a friend of all and who worked for the welfare of all,
Like a brother and a friend,
He produced light in all the three worlds.

vocabulary.meaning: worked for the welfare of all
produced light in the three worlds

devanagari:
अमतेन अतप्पि लोकं,
धम्ममेघपवस्सको;
अस्सासेसि यथा चन्दो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Amatena atappi lokaṃ,
Dhammameghapavassako;
Assāsesi yathā cando,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who gratified the world with the nectar of Dhamma,
Rained like a cloud of Dhamma,
And gave cooling comfort like the moon.

devanagari:
सन्तिपत्तो सन्तिभूतो,
सीतलीभूतो सब्बथा;
परमं सुखं सम्पत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Santipatto santibhūto,
Sītalībhūto sabbathā;
Paramaṃ sukhaṃ sampatto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who had attained peace,
And had become tranquil and cool in every way,
He had achieved the highest bliss (of nibbana).

devanagari:
सदा सन्तो सन्तिददो,
सुखितो सुखदायको;
धम्ममेघं पवस्सेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sadā santo santidado,
Sukhito sukhadāyako;
Dhammameghaṃ pavassesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was always calm and tranquil, providing tranquillity,
Happy himself, he likewise provided happiness to others,
And poured the rain of Dhamma on all.

devanagari:
सन्तकायो सन्तवाचो,
सन्तचित्तो सन्तिधरो;
सब्बूपधिवूपसन्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Santakāyo santavāco,
Santacitto santidharo;
Sabbūpadhivūpasanto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Of calm body and peaceful speech,
With tranquil mind he remained an upholder of peace,
And had completely allayed all substratum of rebirth.

devanagari:
सन्तिधारी सन्तिकारी,
सन्तिचारी सन्तिमनो;
सन्तिसारी सन्तिठितो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Santidhārī santikārī,
Santicārī santimano;
Santisārī santiṭhito,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was a bearer and a dispenser of peace,
Radiating peace he bore a peaceful disposition,
He dwelled in harmony, firmly established in peace.

devanagari:
ब्रह्मपञ्‍ञो ब्रह्मचारी,
ब्रह्मविहारी ब्रह्मञ्‍ञू;
ब्रह्मचक्खु धम्मचक्खु,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Brahmapañño brahmacārī,
Brahmavihārī brahmaññū;
Brahmacakkhu dhammacakkhu,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who had attained the highest Brahmic wisdom,
And led a holy life, a Dhamma life, having realized the essence of Dhamma,
He was the divine eye and the eye of Dhamma.

devanagari:
कायेनसंवुतो सदा,
सदा वाचाय संवुतो;
सदा संवुत मानसो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Kāyenasaṃvuto sadā,
Sadā vācāya saṃvuto;
Sadā saṃvuta mānaso,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was always restrained in his physical and vocal actions,
And incessantly maintaining serene mind.

devanagari:
धम्मचित्तो खमचित्तो,
धीरचित्तो चित्तुत्तमो;
हिरिचित्तो सिरिचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammacitto khamacitto,
Dhīracitto cittuttamo;
Hiricitto siricitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who possessed a Dhamma mind,
a mind full of forgivingness and patience,
With excellent mind, glorious, and conscientious.

vocabulary.meaning: sense of shame, conscientious, restraint, moral appreciation.

devanagari:
हितचित्तो सुखचित्तो,
मोदचित्तो चित्तमुदु;
पीतिचित्तो सीतिचित्तो,
 बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Hitacitto sukhacitto,
Modacitto cittamudu;
Pīticitto sīticitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who had a well-wishing and happy mind,
A joyous and sensitive mind,
Full of affection and tranquillity.

devanagari:
ञाणचित्तो मेधाचित्तो,
विज्‍जाचित्तो विज्‍जाधनी;
पञ्‍ञाचित्तो अञ्‍ञाचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ñāṇacitto medhācitto,
Vijjācitto vijjādhanī;
Paññācitto aññācitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Whose mind was knowledgeable and brimming with intellect,
Full of wisdom, rich in higher knowledge,
He was endowed with insight and divine wisdom.

devanagari:
दित्तिचित्तो जुतिचित्तो,
जुण्हचित्तो आलोकदो;
कन्तिचित्तो खन्तिचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Ditticitto juticitto,
Juṇhacitto ālokado;
Kanticitto khanticitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Whose mind was full of light and effulgence, full of brightness,
He was a giver of light, full of charm and patience.

devanagari:
जवचित्तो बलचित्तो,
थामचित्तो दसबलो;
ठितचित्तो थिरचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Javacitto balacitto,
Thāmacitto dasabalo;
Ṭhitacitto thiracitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Whose mind was very swift, of great vigour and very resolute,
Endowed with the ten supernormal powers, his mind was unshakeable and firm.

devanagari:
सन्तचित्तो दन्तचित्तो,
वसीचित्तो वुसितवा;
सुचिचित्तो रुचिचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Santacitto dantacitto,
Vasīcitto vusitavā;
Sucicitto rucicitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who possessed a tranquil mind, tamed and subdued,
A mind, very pure and brought to splendorous perfection.

vocabulary.word: danta (pp. of dameti) trained, tamed, controlled

vocabulary.meaning: having the senses under control, mastering

devanagari:
गुत्तचित्तो मुत्तचित्तो,
पसन्‍नचित्तो चित्तुजु;
सुमनचित्तो सुचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Guttacitto muttacitto,
Pasannacitto cittuju;
Sumanacitto sucitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Whose mind was guarded, liberated, joyous and straight,
Of pure and pleasant disposition.

devanagari:
पगुणो सुपञ्‍ञचित्तो,
संयतचित्तो सुवतो;
पसन्तिपस्सद्धिचित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Paguṇo supaññacitto,
Saṃyatacitto suvato;
Pasantipassaddhicitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Full of knowledge, endowed with wisdom,
Whose mind was restrained, very particular and dutiful,
Tranquil and serene.

devanagari:
अग्गविज्‍जो अग्गविञ्‍ञू,
अग्गविद्वा अग्गविदू;
अग्गपुञ्‍ञो अग्गपञ्‍ञो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Aggavijjo aggaviññū,
Aggavidvā aggavidū;
Aggapuñño aggapañño,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was foremost in wisdom and first amongst the learned,
Foremost amongst the knowledgeable and the wise,
And foremost amongst those whose deeds are righteous and virtuous.

devanagari:
अग्गलद्धो अग्गक्खातो,
अग्गपन्थपकासको;
अग्गवा अग्गदस्सावि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Aggaladdho aggakkhāto,
Aggapanthapakāsako;
Aggavā aggadassāvi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was ahead of all and the most renowned,
The first to discover and share the Noble Path,
And the foremost amongst all who perceived with insight the path.

devanagari:
अग्गपुग्गलो अग्गग्गो,
ञाणग्गो ञाणपुङ्गवो;
धम्मपुग्गलो धम्मग्गो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Aggapuggalo aggaggo,
Ñāṇaggo ñāṇapuṅgavo;
Dhammapuggalo dhammaggo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Supreme and foremost amongst all beings,
Foremost in wisdom, endowed with ultimate knowledge,
Filled with Dhamma he was the foremost on Dhamma’s path.

devanagari:
अग्गधम्मविभूसितो,
अग्गधम्म-अलङ्कितो;
अग्गधम्मसुसोभितो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Aggadhammavibhūsito,
Aggadhamma-alaṅkito;
Aggadhammasusobhito,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
He was adorned, embellished and resplendent
With the Supreme, the Noble Dhamma.

devanagari:
अग्गपूजितो थोमितो,
अग्गमानितो वन्दितो;
अग्गभिवादितो पुज्‍जो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Aggapūjito thomito,
Aggamānito vandito;
Aggabhivādito pujjo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was the foremost amongst the worshipped and the extolled,
The honoured and the adored,
And amongst those to be venerated and revered.

devanagari:
धम्मस्स भूसनो भब्बो,
धीरो धम्मपतिट्ठितो;
अग्गपतिट्ठितो अग्गो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammassa bhūsano bhabbo,
Dhīro dhammapatiṭṭhito;
Aggapatiṭṭhito aggo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The best embellishment of Dhamma,
He was resolute and established in the Dhamma,
A great pioneer and the most respected.

devanagari:
मग्गस्स कोविदो चापि,
अमग्गस्सापि कोविदो;
अग्गमग्गमुग्घाटेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Maggassa kovido cāpi,
Amaggassāpi kovido;
Aggamaggamugghāṭesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Knower of the right path,
and even the wrong path in all detail,
Revealer of the Noble Path.

devanagari:
अग्गगोचरो अग्गगू,
अग्गञ्‍ञू अग्गदेसको;
अग्गञाणी अग्गभाणी,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Aggagocaro aggagū,
Aggaññū aggadesako;
Aggañāṇī aggabhāṇī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Endowed with foresight, he was the first to walk on the Dhamma Path,
Foremost amongst the seers and the preachers,
Amongst the wise and the teachers.

vocabulary.meaning: going, having gone, being perfected in

devanagari:
खेमप्पत्तो खेमङ्गतो,
अग्गप्पत्तो अग्गङ्गतो;
सिवप्पत्तो सिवङ्गतो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Khemappatto khemaṅgato,
Aggappatto aggaṅgato;
Sivappatto sivaṅgato,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who attained the highest
and most excellent state of tranquillity and security,
And achieved happiness and bliss.

devanagari:
पत्तधम्मो पत्तबोधि,
पत्तमग्गो पत्तफलो;
पत्त-अमतो पत्तत्थो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Pattadhammo pattabodhi,
Pattamaggo pattaphalo;
Patta-amato pattattho,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who reached and realized Dhamma and attained enlightenment,
Attained the right path and fruition,
And attained the Deathless state, the desired goal.

devanagari:
पत्तञाणो पत्तमेधो,
पत्तधम्मनियामको;
पत्त-अनन्तो पत्तन्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Pattañāṇo pattamedho,
Pattadhammaniyāmako;
Patta-ananto pattanto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who attained the knowledge and wisdom,
Discovered the laws of Dhamma,
And realized both, the finite and the infinite.

devanagari:
परमत्थसच्‍चं पत्तो,
पत्तखेमो पत्तसिवो;
पत्त-अच्‍चुतो पत्तग्गो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Paramatthasaccaṃ patto,
Pattakhemo pattasivo;
Patta-accuto pattaggo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who realised the ultimate truth and the state of Nibbāna,
Attained the state of beatitude and eternity,
And reached the foremost state.

devanagari:
पन्‍नासज्‍जो पन्‍नासत्तो,
पन्‍नालम्हो पन्‍नालयो;
पन्‍नसूलो पन्‍नसल्‍लो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Pannāsajjo pannāsatto,
Pannālamho pannālayo;
Pannasūlo pannasallo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who gave up attachment and clinging
And every support and all lust
And all stakes and spikes (the piercing stings of craving and sorrow).

devanagari:
इञ्‍जारित्तो इन्धारित्तो,
इच्छारित्तो रित्त-अघो;
एधरित्तो गेधरित्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Iñjāritto indhāritto,
Icchāritto ritta-agho;
Edharitto gedharitto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was free from agitation and restlessness,
Free from desires and unwholesomeness,
And free from craving and greed.

devanagari:
मनोगुत्तो वचीगुत्तो,
कायगुत्तो गुत्तिवरो;
गुत्तकम्मो गुत्तधम्मो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Manogutto vacīgutto,
Kāyagutto guttivaro;
Guttakammo guttadhammo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who restrained his mind, his speech and body,
Restrained himself in an excellent manner,
And was well-protected by kamma and Dhamma.

devanagari:
चित्तगुत्तो चित्तदन्तो,
सातच्‍च चित्त संयतो;
चित्तमुत्तो चित्तसन्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Cittagutto cittadanto,
Sātacca citta saṃyato;
Cittamutto cittasanto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who restrained, protected
And continuously tamed his mind,
Liberated and pacified it.

devanagari:
चक्‍कवत्ती धम्मराजा,
धम्मचक्‍कविभूसितो;
अधम्मचक्‍कं विभञ्‍जि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Cakkavattī dhammarājā,
Dhammacakkavibhūsito;
Adhammacakkaṃ vibhañji,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was a universal monarch
And a king of righteousness,
Adorned with the Wheel of Dhamma,
He had shattered the vicious wheel of unrighteousness.

devanagari:
सद्धम्ममुद्धाभिसित्तो,
धम्ममहारञ्‍ञो बुधो;
धम्मसासनं ठापेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Saddhammamuddhābhisitto,
Dhammamahārañño budho;
Dhammasāsanaṃ ṭhāpesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Consecrated with the spirit of true Dhamma,
He was the great, wise Dhamma king,
And established the foundation of Dhamma.

devanagari:
धम्न्लमहाराजाधिपो,
धम्मीसो धम्मसम्मतो;
धम्मसमत्थो मुनिन्दो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammamahārājādhipo,
Dhammīso dhammasammato;
Dhammasamattho munindo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The great emperor of Dhamma, a lord of Dhamma,
Who had the sanction of Dhamma, was proficient in Dhamma,
A great sage.

devanagari:
धम्मनाथो धम्मस्सामी,
धम्मिन्दो धम्मसासको;
धम्मसक्‍को धम्मसत्था.
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammanātho dhammassāmī,
Dhammindo dhammasāsako;
Dhammasakko dhammasatthā.
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The protector and patron of Dhamma,
The lord and provider of Dhamma,
A righteous ruler and teacher of Dhamma.

devanagari:
धम्मगुत्तो पापमुत्तो,
धम्मयुत्तो धम्मधनी;
धम्मञत्तो धम्मप्पत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammagutto pāpamutto,
Dhammayutto dhammadhanī;
Dhammañatto dhammappatto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was protected by Dhamma, free from evil,
Yoked to and rich in it, Dhamma was his wealth,
He realized and attained it.

devanagari:
धम्मसञ्‍ञो धम्मपञ्‍ञो,
धम्म-अभिञ्‍ञो धम्मञ्‍ञो;
धञ्‍ञो धम्मपरायणो.
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammasañño dhammapañño,
Dhamma-abhiñño dhammañño;
Dhañño dhammaparāyaṇo.
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Possessing Dhamma-consciousness and Dhamma-wisdom,
He had special knowledge, and proficiency in Dhamma,
And was the Blessed One, the great devout.

devanagari:
धम्मञाणी धम्मभाणी,
धम्मभासी धम्मविदू;
धम्मवादी धम्मवाची,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammañāṇī dhammabhāṇī,
Dhammabhāsī dhammavidū;
Dhammavādī dhammavācī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who possessed profound knowledge of Dhamma and preached Dhamma,
Eloquent in Dhamma, he knew and expounded and taught it well.

devanagari:
धम्मकायो धम्मरूपो,
धम्मनामो धम्ममुदो;
धम्मपतिट्ठो धम्मट्ठो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammakāyo dhammarūpo,
Dhammanāmo dhammamudo;
Dhammapatiṭṭho dhammaṭṭho,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
The embodiment of Dhamma and a Dhamma incarnate,
Whose name signified Dhamma, who rejoiced in it,
And was established and rooted in Dhamma.

devanagari:
धम्मकारी धम्मधारी,
धम्मचारी धम्मधरो;
धम्मसारी धम्मभावी,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammakārī dhammadhārī,
Dhammacārī dhammadharo;
Dhammasārī dhammabhāvī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who acted in accordance with Dhamma and was the upholder of Dhamma,
Walked on its path and was its bearer,
As a practitioner of Dhamma he always developed it.

devanagari:
धम्मधारको धोरेय्यो,
यो सुद्धधम्मपालको;
धम्मामतोगधं पत्तो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammadhārako dhoreyyo,
Yo suddhadhammapālako;
Dhammāmatogadhaṃ patto,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who bore the yoke of Dhamma,
A custodian of pure Dhamma,
Who tasted its nectar of deathlessness .

devanagari:
धम्मपटिभानप्पत्तो,
धम्मप्पटिपदाविदू;
पटिसम्भिदामग्गञ्‍ञू,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammapaṭibhānappatto,
Dhammappaṭipadāvidū;
Paṭisambhidāmaggaññū,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who attained the quality of readiness of speech in regards to Dhamma
Mastered the noble path of Dhamma,
And knew the path of knowledge.

devanagari:
धम्मतिकिच्छको छेको,
विसल्‍लो सल्‍लकन्तको;
सब्बोपकारी भिसक्‍को.
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammatikicchako cheko,
Visallo sallakantako;
Sabbopakārī bhisakko.
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was a very skillful Dhamma physician,
Free from the dart of grief, removing the dart of sorrow in others,
A true benefactor to all, a real healer.

devanagari:
धम्मसिरोमणि धम्मी,
धम्मसिखरसेखरो;
धम्मचूळामणि चारु,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammasiromaṇi dhammī,
Dhammasikharasekharo;
Dhammacūḷāmaṇi cāru,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was like a crest-jewel of Dhamma,
Imbued with its spirit,
Dhamma shone on his forehead, like a beautiful diadem.

devanagari:
धम्मभूसनभूसितो,
धम्मालङ्कारलङ्कितो;
धम्माभरणसोभितो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammabhūsanabhūsito,
Dhammālaṅkāralaṅkito;
Dhammābharaṇasobhito,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was adorned with the ornament of Dhamma,
And decorated with Dhamma
Splendorous with all its embellishments.

devanagari:
धम्मसमुद्दो धम्मवा,
ञाणसागरो ञाणवा;
पञ्‍ञवारिधि पञ्‍ञवा,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammasamuddo dhammavā,
Ñāṇasāgaro ñāṇavā;
Paññavāridhi paññavā,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was an ocean of Dhamma, brimming with Dhamma,
An ocean of knowledge, abundant in knowledge,
An ocean of wisdom, drenched with wisdom.

devanagari:
अधम्ममुत्तो धम्मगू,
अञ्‍ञणमुत्तो ञाणगू;
अविज्‍जामुत्तो विज्‍जावा,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Adhammamutto dhammagū,
Aññaṇamutto ñāṇagū;
Avijjāmutto vijjāvā,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was an ocean of Dhamma, brimming with Dhamma,
An ocean of knowledge, abundant in knowledge,
An ocean of wisdom, drenched with wisdom.

devanagari:
धम्मधारा पवाहेसि,
पापधारानिरोधको;
अतित्तानं सुतोसेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammadhārā pavāhesi,
Pāpadhārānirodhako;
Atittānaṃ sutosesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who caused the streams of Dhamma flow freely,
Who dried up the streams of sin,
And satisfied the dissatisfied entirely.

devanagari:
धम्ममेघो पञ्‍ञामेघो,
धम्मामतं पवस्सयी;
रजोजल्‍लं विधोवेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammamegho paññāmegho,
Dhammāmataṃ pavassayī;
Rajojallaṃ vidhovesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who, like a cloud of Dhamma and wisdom,
Poured the Dhamma, nectar-like,
And who washed away the dirt and mire (of ignorance).

devanagari:
सब्बकम्मकिलेसानि,
अनवसेस वाहयी;
धम्मगङ्गा पवाहेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sabbakammakilesāni,
Anavasesa vāhayī;
Dhammagaṅgā pavāhesi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who aroused the Ganga of Dhamma to flow,
Thus washing away all defiling deeds and defilements.

devanagari:
सीलग्गो समाधिप्पत्तो,
पञ्‍ञप्पत्तो सुभावितो;
 धम्मसुधारसं पायी,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Sīlaggo samādhippatto,
Paññappatto subhāvito;
Dhammasudhārasaṃ pāyī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Foremost in preserving the precepts of morality,
He had attained concentration and wisdom,
Developed all of these and made the people drink the excellent nectar of Dhamma.

devanagari:
अनाथानं भवनाथो,
भीतानं अभयङ्करो;
सरणङ्करो दीनानं,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Anāthānaṃ bhavanātho,
Bhītānaṃ abhayaṅkaro;
Saraṇaṅkaro dīnānaṃ,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
A universal protector of the destitute,
He made the frightened fearless,
And gave refuge to the miserable.

devanagari:
महासरणदायको,
परित्ताणप्पदायको;
आरक्खणदाता सत्था,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Mahāsaraṇadāyako,
Parittāṇappadāyako;
Ārakkhaṇadātā satthā,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who provided great refuge,
Great shelter and
Was a guardian teacher.

devanagari:
भीरुताणो भीरुलेणो,
भीरुसरणदायको;
भीरु-आरक्खको भिय्यो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Bhīrutāṇo bhīruleṇo,
Bhīrusaraṇadāyako;
Bhīru-ārakkhako bhiyyo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who sheltered the scared, like a safe cave for the frightened,
A patron for the fearful,
And a strong protector for the timid.

devanagari:
धम्मदाता धम्मताता,
धम्मक्खाता धम्मसखा;
धम्मारक्खो सत्थावरो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Dhammadātā dhammatātā,
Dhammakkhātā dhammasakhā;
Dhammārakkho satthāvaro,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was a dispenser and defender of Dhamma,
A great expounder, supporter and protector of Dhamma,
A perfect teacher.

devanagari:
सुञ्‍ञतण्हो सुञ्‍ञरागो,
सुञ्‍ञरङ्गो सुञ्‍ञरजो;
सुञ्‍ञछन्दो सुञ्‍ञनन्दी,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Suññataṇho suññarāgo,
Suññaraṅgo suññarajo;
Suññachando suññanandī,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was void of desires and cravings,
Of all attachments and dirt,
And void of impulses and yearnings.

devanagari:
सुञ्‍ञरोसो सुञ्‍ञदोसो,
सुञ्‍ञदोहो सुञ्‍ञदहो;
सुञ्‍ञसापो सुञ्‍ञतापो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Suññaroso suññadoso,
Suññadoho suññadaho;
Suññasāpo suññatāpo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was void of all rage and aversion,
Of all rancour and terror,
And void of all curse and scourges.

devanagari:
आसासुञ्‍ञो इस्सासुञ्‍ञो,
एजासुञ्‍ञो सुञ्‍ञ-इणो;
इञ्‍जासुञ्‍ञो इन्धासुञ्‍ञो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Āsāsuñño issāsuñño,
Ejāsuñño suñña-iṇo;
Iñjāsuñño indhāsuñño,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was void of hope and envy,
Void of desires and liability,
And void of agitation and all fuel.

devanagari:
पापसुञ्‍ञो पुञ्‍ञसुञ्‍ञो,
अहंसुञ्‍ञो सुञ्‍ञममो;
कङ्खासुञ्‍ञो सङ्कासुञ्‍ञो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Pāpasuñño puññasuñño,
Ahaṃsuñño suññamamo;
Kaṅkhāsuñño saṅkāsuñño,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who was void of sin and righteousness,
Of egoism and selfishness,
And void of all doubts and suspicion.

devanagari:
वन्तरागो वन्तदोसो,
वन्तमोहो वन्तमलो;
वन्तकसावो वन्तीघो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Vantarāgo vantadoso,
Vantamoho vantamalo;
Vantakasāvo vantīgho,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who gave up all craving and aversion,
All delusions and defilements,
Who left behind all fundamental faults and any influence of evil.

vocabulary.meaning: fundamental faults of rāga, dosa & moha, stain, defect

devanagari:
कम्मनुदो क्‍लेसनुदो,
कलिनुदो नुन्‍नमलो;
सब्बथा अविज्‍जानुदो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Kammanudo klesanudo,
Kalinudo nunnamalo;
Sabbathā avijjānudo,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Who dispelled all kamma, all afflictions and misfortunes,
Cleansed himself of all defilements,
And removed ignorance in every way.

devanagari:
भूरिमेधो भूरिबोधो,
भूरिबोधिपकासको;
भूरिञाणं पसारेसि,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Bhūrimedho bhūribodho,
Bhūribodhipakāsako;
Bhūriñāṇaṃ pasāresi,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Superb in sagacity, supremely enlightened,
He superbly explained enlightenment,
And propagated wisdom thoroughly.

devanagari:
अक्खरानं सन्‍निपाते,
दक्खो पुब्बापरानञ्‍च;
निरुत्तिपदकोविदो,
बुद्धं तं पणमाम्यहं.
romanpali:
Akkharānaṃ sannipāte,
Dakkho pubbāparānañca;
Niruttipadakovido,
Buddhaṃ taṃ paṇamāmyahaṃ.
english:
I bow to the Buddha,
Very skilful in proper placement of words,
He knew which one should come first and which one later,
Proficient in etymology and in poetry.
